title: 104_hr2083
content: The Act titled "Tax Reduction and Economic Growth Act of 1995" allows for tax reduction in the event of low growth. The Director of the Office of Management and Budget must notify the President and Congress if economic growth is below 1.5% and national unemployment is above 6.5% for specific periods. After notification of economic indicators, the President may authorize temporary tax reductions for a specified calendar year to stimulate the economy. The tax reductions would be effective for taxable years in the specified calendar year. The President can authorize temporary tax reductions for a specified calendar year to stimulate the economy. This includes reducing tax rates for the first income bracket by up to 3 percent and adjusting tax amounts accordingly. The President can authorize temporary tax reductions for a specified calendar year to stimulate the economy. The tax amounts set forth in tables will be adjusted to reflect the rate reduction. Withholding tables will be modified to ensure the full calendar year effect of the reduction is reflected through withholding reductions. If economic growth requirements are met, a temporary surtax will be implemented for taxable years following the satisfaction of these requirements. Effective for taxable years beginning in the first subsequent calendar year for which the economic growth requirements are satisfied, tax rates will be increased by a certain percentage, except for individuals with Adjusted Gross Income below $50,000 and joint filers below $75,000. The tax rates for individuals with Adjusted Gross Income below $75,000 will not exceed the previous year's rates. Withholding tables will be adjusted to reflect the rate increases. Economic growth requirements must be met for the President to determine tax rate adjustments for the following calendar year. The tax rates will be modified based on economic growth requirements, with a focus on GDP and unemployment rates. The President will determine the percentage increase in tax rates to balance out the decrease in tax receipts. The President will determine the percentage increase in tax rates under section 1 of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to balance out the decrease in tax receipts, without raising rates for individuals with Adjusted Gross Income below certain thresholds. The percentage will be published in the Federal Register before the beginning of the relevant calendar year. SEC. 3. Treatment under pay-as-you-go procedures: Any changes in receipts from section 2 of this Act will not affect the Balanced Budget and Emergency Deficit Control Act of 1985.
